Maximum transverse momentum invariant mass of \(b\bar{b}\) pairs.
\(m_{\rm uu}^{\rm min\,RR}\): minimum invariant mass of the \(uu\) pair in the reconstructed region.
Minimum invariant mass of the \(uu\) pair in the reduced resolution (RR) context.
\(\mathbf{c}\) \(p_{\rm T,uu}^{\rm min\,A\,R}\): minimum transverse momentum of \(uu\) pair in the anti-kT algorithm.
Minimum transverse momentum of the \(uu\) pair in the anti-kT algorithm.
\(m_{\rm bb}^{\rm min\,A\,R}\): minimum invariant mass of \(b\bar{b}\) pairs in the anti-kT algorithm.
Minimum \(b\bar{b}\) invariant mass in the Angular Resolution (A\,R) context.

name: Figure 1

name: Figure 19
mentions: Figure 19 demonstrates the effect of various systematic uncertainties on the fitted value of \(\mu\) and the constraints provided by the data

The \(t\bar{t}+c\bar{c}\) normalisation uncertainty is ranked third (Fig. 19) and its pull is slightly negative, while the post-fit yields for \(t\bar{t}+c\bar{c}\) increase significantly in the four- and five-jet regions in the single-lepton channel and in the two- and three-jet regions of the dilepton channel (see Tables 10, 11 of Appendix 1)
Figure 19: The fitted values of the nuisance parameters with the largest impact on the measured signal strength

mathsDefinitions: Signal-strength parameter, ratio of observed/expected cross section to SM cross section.
A top-antitop pair production event with an additional charm-anticharm pair.
keywords: systematic uncertainties, fitted value, normalisation uncertainty, pull, post-fit yields, four-jet region, five-jet region, single-lepton channel, two-jet region, three-jet region, dilepton channel, nuisance parameters, signal
